New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the bottom of the fifth inning and later scored the game-winning run with a solo home run in the ninth inning, while Mookie Betts followed with a game-winning RBI double in the bottom of the ninth to secure the win for the Los Angeles Dodgers against the Colorado Rockies on September 22, 2024.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers won the series against the Rockies with a dramatic back-to-back home run victory in the ninth inning, showcasing playoff-like energy and focus.
The game was tied 5-4 heading into the bottom of the ninth inning before Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts delivered clutch performances to secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Dodgers entered the series aiming to maintain their playoff momentum and secure the National League West division title, while the Colorado Rockies were already out of postseason contention.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers' strong performance and clutch plays demonstrated their ability to maintain high-energy gameplay even as they secured a postseason berth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockies' bullpen performed well after the fifth inning, but the Dodgers' offense and bullpen combined efforts to secure the win.
